snippet: The long-dominant United States and fast-growing China are both seeking to bolster their naval power in the region.
abstract: China appears to be exhibiting a new assertiveness in the strategically critical, potentially energy-rich South China Sea region, as it begins deep-sea oil drilling project and makes further claims on islands in the waterway; country's show of power could potentially compete with the United States, which is also seeking to enhance its naval power in the region.

byline.contributor: Bree Feng contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: The long-dominant United States and fast-growing China are both seeking to bolster their naval power in the region.

headline.seo: Beijing Projects Power in Strategic South China Sea
headline.main: Beijing Exhibiting New Assertiveness in South China Sea
headline.print_headline: Beijing Exhibiting New Assertiveness In South China Sea

keywords.value: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
keywords.name: glocations
